thread.title: Vegas charges before rain halts play
thread.title_full: Vegas charges before rain halts play

title: Vegas charges before rain halts play
text:
Vegas charges before rain halts play February 17, 2017 By The Associated Press Follow @PGATOUR Highlights Jhonattan Vegas birdies No. 1 at Genesis Open In the second round the 2017 Genesis Open, Jhonattan Vegas two-putts from 68 feet for birdie on the par-5 1st hole. 
LOS ANGELES -- Rain and high wind finally hit Friday at the Genesis Open and wiped out play before all but 24 players completed the second round. 
Jhonattan Vegas was at 7-under par through 14 holes. He was tied with Sam Saunders, who did not have to hit a shot on Friday. Neither did Dustin Johnson, who needs a victory to have a chance at reaching No. 1 in the world. Johnson was 5 under and also did not tee off. 
Play was to resume at 7 a.m. Saturday. 
The tournament did well to finish off the first round Friday morning and get in more than five hours before a eucalyptus tree cracked under the wind beyond the 14th tee. The round was suspended to allow fans to get off the course. MORE FROM PGA TOUR
